intro: Calpidia taitensis, commonly known as the Taiti calpidia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Taiti in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within coastal forests. Due to habitat loss, Calpidia taitensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
